purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses and hostname, then sends this data to external domains via HTTP GET requests.
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains that appear to be part of a tracking or command and control infrastructure
Sending system identifiers (MAC addresses, hostname) to external domains without user consent
Use of 'rejectUnauthorized: false' which disables SSL certificate verification
No validation or sanitization of input data before sending to external servers
analysis: This code performs several suspicious activities: 1) It enumerates all network interfaces and collects MAC addresses, 2) It gathers system information like hostname and user info, 3) It constructs tracking data containing this information, 4) It sends this sensitive data to multiple external domains using HTTP requests with disabled SSL verification, 5) The target domains appear to be part of a tracking/c2 infrastructure based on their naming patterns. This behavior is typical of malware or spyware that exfiltrates device information.
conclusion: This code demonstrates clear malicious behavior by collecting system information and transmitting it to external servers without user consent.
